Hi Keith,

I wrote the CodePlex version of SharpNEAT one week last summer. It's essentially
the same as the official SharpNEAT (Sourceforge version), but it has support for
distributed execution. As far as I'm aware, Peter hasn't gotten around to
incorporating distributed execution into SharpNEAT and I'm fairly certain there
is no central repository for all 3 versions you mentioned.

Wesley


Quoting krn_2k <krn_2k@...>:

>
> Hi Peter,
>    Did you eventually modify SharpNeat to support validation data
> sets? Or does anybody know if there any Neat implementations/code
> snippets etc out there (SharpNeat or otherwise) that support
> cross-validation?
>
> As I am fairly new to NEAT, I begun by searching around for SharpNeat
> and noticed that there are at least three different implementations:
> SourceForge, codeplex and a version supporting HyperNeat/.NET 2.0.  Is
> there by chance a central CVS/Subversion repository coordinating these
> together where the SharpNeat project is maintained and/or the patches
> for update versions available?
>
> Thanks,
> Keith.
>
> --- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "petervermont" <pandrews@...> wrote:
> >
> > In the recent thread "New To NEAT - A few Newbie Questions" Ken wrote:
> >
> > >What you do is evaluate each
> > >generation on the training set and test the champion of each
> > >generation on the validation set. When the validation scores start
> > >going down, you stop evolution.
> >
> > I am using SharpNEAT and am new to all this so I would appreciate a
> > little more detail.
> >
> > I have implemented two interface, IExperiment and INetworkEvaluator.
> > Neither interface appears to have any concept of a generation or of a
> > champion. It looks to me like I might want/need to subclass
> > SingleFilePopulationEvaluator so that I can override
> > EvaluatePopulation. I can then call the superclass' EvaluatePopulation
> > and after it completes do my validation testing on the
> > EvolutionAlgorithm's BestGenome. I was then thinking
> > that once I wished to stop evolution, I could set the
> > EvolutionAlgorithm SearchCompleted boolean. Finally, I can modify
> > SharpNeatGui's SearchThread to check the ea's SearchCompleted flag so
> > that the thread will stop.
> >
> > Am I on the right track here? How have others handled cross-validation
> > and prevention of over-fitting?
> >
> > Thanks,
> >
> > Peter
> >
>
>
>
